sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: France is set to become the first nation to send Western-designed armoured vehicles to Ukraine to help fight Russia's aggression.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Unseasonably high temperatures wreak havoc with the winter tourism sector in Central Europe and could cause lasting damage to Austria's forests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Western allies have moved towards supplying armoured battle vehicles to Ukraine for the first time since Russia's war began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But they're not the heavier tanks it requested.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: France says it will deliver light tanks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: President Macron told Ukraine's leader Paris can spare some of its AMX-10RC combat vehicles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's been gradually replacing them with new Jaguar battle tanks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In his nightly address, Volodymyr Zelensky stressed troops needed even more military hardware.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We must put an end to the Russian aggression this year, he says, and not postpone any of the defensive capabilities that can speed up the defeat of the terrorist state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Modern Western armored vehicles, Western-type tanks are just one of these key capabilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Russia claims a continued offensive in the direction of the Donetsk region, which it partially occupies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It says it has successfully repelled Ukrainian counterattacks in the south.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is Zlatibor in western Serbia,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: normally a popular ski resort now basking in unseasonably high temperatures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Records were broken across Central Europe in the last few days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On December 30th, 31st and January 1st, the capital Belgrade recorded its highest ever temperature for those days. It was 18.2 degrees on December 31st. The record for annual average temperature is likely to be broken too. Bosnia hosted the Winter Olympics in 1984. Now its ski slopes are barren.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Hotels are being forced to slash prices to try to attract customers, while also laying off staff.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Tourism authorities in parts of the country are considering declaring a state of natural emergency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's not just human activity that is having to adjust.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In this Austrian forest, trees are already sprouting as if it were spring.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It means that they'll be vulnerable to lasting damage, both from potential frost and thriving insect populations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's important that it's cold in the winter, firstly so that few pests survive and secondly so that the trees are not disturbed in their resting phase.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Plant life too could suffer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Flowers in these regions are used to spending the winter under a protective cover of snow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The World Health Organization has criticized what it calls China's very narrow definition of Covid-19 deaths, warning that official statistics are not showing the true impact of the outbreak. The Health Watchdog says Beijing only reported 13 official COVID deaths for the whole country in December after the government recently changed its way of recording the figures. We continue to ask China for more rapid, regular, reliable data on hospitalizations and deaths, as well as more comprehensive real-time viral sequencing. We are really concerned about the current COVID-19 epidemiological picture, with both intense transmission in several parts of the world and a recombinance of variants spreading quickly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The sudden end to China's controversial zero-COVID strategy last month caught the country's fragile health system unprepared.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Fears of intense transmission have sparked international alarm, with the EU becoming the latest to insist pre-flight testing and other restrictions on travelers from China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A second day of conflict and chaos in the Republican-led U.S. House of Representatives

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: as it once again fails to elect a speaker.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Motion is adopted. Accordingly, the House stands adjourned until noon tomorrow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Frustration for the leading candidate, Republican Kevin McCarthy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But he's not giving up. He's now lost six votes, having failed to convince 20 hardliners within his own party to back him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The humiliating standoff has paralyzed the lower chamber of Congress. McCarthy's allies have sought to cut a deal with his rebel detractors, but there is increasingly bitter infighting. We will compromise, but we will not capitulate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And there's a very serious difference. There's 222 Republicans in our conference now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There's 222 Republicans in our conference now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So if 20 people are able to drive this train however they want to, 202 of us might as well go home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Until a speaker is chosen, no congressional business can begin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: New members cannot be sworn in, no committees can be formed, and legislation cannot be passed. Tech giant Amazon is planning to slash 18,000 jobs in a bid to reduce costs amid the cost

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: of living crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's the largest set of layoffs in the Seattle-based company's history, although it's only a small part of its 1.5 million global workforce.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The company's CEO confirmed the losses will mostly impact the company's brick and mortar stores, including Amazon Fresh and Amazon Go, and there will be cuts to the European workforce. The move comes as Amazon faces a return to in-person shopping, as well as a sharp drop in purchasing power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Proof of a Covid vaccination is becoming a problem once again for tennis star Novak Djokovic. He's set to miss two of the most prestigious events on the calendar outside the Grand Slams, the Indian Wells and the Miami Open. It's because the United States travel authorities have extended the requirement for non-U.S. nationals to be vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Twelve months ago, Djokovic was detained in an immigration hotel on arrival in Australia due to refusing to be vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He was later deported.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Demonstrators took to the streets of Georgia and a number of other European cities on Wednesday

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: demanding the release of former President Mikhail Saakashvili.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Saakashvili's medical team say his health has deteriorated since he was imprisoned in October 21.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He has staged repeated hunger strikes to protest his incarceration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are joining the global rally to save the health of the third president of Georgia Mikhail Saakashvili rally which was announced by our Ukrainian friends and now the demonstrations and manifestations are ongoing in different countries in hundreds of countries in the capitals of different countries in free world and the main message is to save the life save the Mikhail Saakashvili immediately after his return from Ukraine Saakashvili was detained and is serving a six-year sentence at a Georgian prison for the abuse of power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But his supporters believe the court's decision was politically motivated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: International and local medics say the 55-year-old is suffering from rapidly progressive dementia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Some of them suggest it could be related to his alleged poisoning by heavy metals while in custody.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They are calling for his sentence to be suspended and transferred abroad for medical treatment. However, Georgian officials deny the former president is in a critical condition and say he is trying to hinder the judicial process and mislead society and international partners. He is also on trial on separate charges for violently dispersing an anti-government rally in November 2007 and an illegal border crossing. Now the pressure has increased on the president of Georgia Salome Zurabishvili. It's been already a few weeks since the demonstrations are being held in front of the president's administration of Georgia. The citizens, current and former diplomats, politicians, and Georgian doctors along them, they all urge the president of Georgia to pardon the imprisoned Mikhail Saakashvili.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They all say that the health condition of the country's third president is getting worse every day, which may lead to fatal consequences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Mariam Kukhilova for Euronews.
